title: US Supreme Court to weigh transgender athlete bans
byline: The US Supreme Court on Tuesday wades into the hot-button issue of transgender athletes in girls’ and women’s sports.

title: Alonso leaves Real Madrid, Arbeloa appointed as coach
byline: Real Madrid said on Monday coach Xabi Alonso has left the Spanish giants by mutual consent, to be replaced by Alvaro Arbeloa.

title: Sri Lanka records 67,762 tourist arrivals in early January 2026
byline: Sri Lanka welcomed 67,762 tourists between January 1 and January 8, 2026, according to provisional figures from the latest tourism performance summary, indicating a relatively slow start to the year.

title: Australian Captain Announces Retirement
byline: Australia captain Alyssa Healy said on Tuesday she will to retire from cricket in March after the team’s home series with India, ending a storied career.

title: Motor traders push to scrap used vehicle tax break
byline: Sri Lanka’s oldest automotive industry body has stepped up pressure on the government to dismantle what it calls a deeply flawed tax concession on used vehicle imports, warning that the policy is eroding state revenue, distorting competition and undermining foreign exchange discipline.

title: Mattala Airport accumulates Rs.39bn in losses as govt. pivots to new PPP model
byline: Mattala Rajapaksa International Airport (MRIA) has accumulated a staggering Rs.39.3 billion in net losses over the past six years, a recent audit revealed, as the government moves to scrap a previously arranged management handover to an India-Russia joint venture, in favour of a new public-private partnership (PPP) model.

title: Police warn of rising extortion racket involving secret video recordings
byline: Police said complaints regarding video recording of sexual relations of married women and their paramours, and young men and women, to extort them under threat of sharing the videos on websites have been increasing.

title: Veteran Journalist Iqbal Athas Passes Away at 81
byline: Veteran journalist and defence analyst Iqbal Athas passed away this morning at the age of 81 following a brief illness.

title: Schoolteacher accused of fraud, claims she too was a Facebook scam victim
byline: A woman arrested by the Financial Crimes Branch of the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) and remanded over allegations of defrauding people of several hundred thousand rupees through threats and deceit, told the Colombo Chief Magistrate that she herself had fallen victim to an online scam while working as a Facebook-based worker.

title: SMEs hit by Covid, Easter Attack fall from frying pan to fire
byline: Small and medium-scale enterprises affected by the Easter Sunday attacks have fallen from the frying pan into the fire due to the banking sector’s failure to implement recommendations made by the Ministry of Industry, according to the Joint District Entrepreneur Organisation.

title: Average tourist spending falls in Sri Lanka
byline: Average tourist spending in Sri Lanka has dropped to US$ 148 a day from US$ 181 in 2018, despite a rise in arrivals, with government authorities now planning for the development of upmarket tourism, an official said yesterday.

title: U.S. Ambassador pays farewell call on President
byline: U.S. Ambassador to Sri Lanka Julie Chung paid a farewell call on President Anura Kumara Dissanayake ahead of her departure from the country on 16 January, marking the conclusion of her tenure as the United States’ top diplomat in Colombo from 2022 to 2026.

title: Apple, Google strike Gemini deal for revamped Siri in major win for Alphabet
byline: Apple (AAPL.O), will use Google’s Gemini models for its revamped Siri coming later this year under a ‌multi-year deal that deepens the tech giants’ alliance in the artificial intelligence era and bolsters Alphabet’s position in the race against OpenAI.

title: US Supreme Court to weigh transgender athlete bans
byline: The US Supreme Court on Tuesday wades into the hot-button issue of transgender athletes in girls’ and women’s sports.

title: Alonso leaves Real Madrid, Arbeloa appointed as coach
byline: Real Madrid said on Monday coach Xabi Alonso has left the Spanish giants by mutual consent, to be replaced by Alvaro Arbeloa.

title: U.S. provides additional $2 Million for Cyclone Ditwah Relief in Sri Lanka
byline: The U.S. Embassy in Sri Lanka today announced an additional $2 million in U.S. humanitarian assistance to support communities affected by Cyclone Ditwah, bringing total U.S. assistance for the response to $4 million.

title: Severe lightning alert for Colombo and four other districts
byline: The Meteorology Department has warned that thundershowers accompanied by severe lightning are likely to occur in parts of Colombo, Kalutara, Galle, Matara and Ratnapura districts.

title: Presidential Secretariat declines RTI disclosure on 68 vehicles
byline: The Designated Officer of the Presidential Secretariat has rejected a request made under the Right to Information (RTI) Act seeking vehicle number details of 68 vehicles handed over to the Secretariat following the conclusion of the tenure of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe.

title: Ondansetron samples to be sent for global testing
byline: Complying with the request made by the Indian company which manufactured Ondansetron injection in question, local health authorities have decided to send samples of the withdrawn injection batches to a World Health Organisation (WHO)-accredited laboratory for international testing, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Fined for destroying artefacts
byline: A group of three suspects who had been arrested by Ethimale Police and produced before Siyambalanduwa Magistrate Dinushka Rosan Anuruddha Samaraweera for causing damage to an archaeological site and destroying nine ancient rock pillars were fined Rs. 200,000 when they pleaded guilty to the charges.

title: President assures to uphold financial discipline in rebuilding programme
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today that the government will strictly uphold financial discipline while taking responsibility for each rupee donated for the rebuilding initiative.

title: Online appeals open for grade 6 admissions for 2026
byline: The first round of appeals for admission to Grade 6 for the year 2026, based on the 2025 Grade 5 Scholarship Examination results, can be submitted online from January 12 to January 25, the Education Ministry said.

title: Trump briefed on military and covert options for Iran, reports
byline: President Donald Trump has been briefed on a wide range of covert and military tools for use in Iran, two Department of Defense officials told the BBC’s US partner, CBS News.

title: CID arrests two suspects in Rs. 50 Mn textile scam
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has arrested two suspects in connection with the fraudulent theft of textile raw materials valued at nearly Rs. 50 million from a private factory in Kilinochchi.

title: Namal accuses Minister Lal Kantha of spreading religious hatred
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) National Organiser and MP Namal Rajapaksa has accused Agriculture, Livestock, Lands and Irrigation Minister K.D. Lal Kantha of spreading religious hatred and insulting Buddhism and the Maha Sangha, claiming the Minister’s recent remarks violate the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights (ICCPR) Act No. 56 of 2007.

title: Search for bodies still continues but hampered due to rain
byline: Search for those who are missing as a result of the cyclone Ditwah is still continuing, but operations have been hampered due to rain that is prevailing in the respective areas, state officials said yesterday.

title: National housing programme–2026 to be launched in Jaffna on Jan 16
byline: The National Housing Programme–2026 will be inaugurated in Jaffna on January 16 under the theme “A Place to Belong, A Beautiful Life,” Deputy Minister of Housing, Construction and Water Supply T.B. Sarath announced.

title: Online scams doubles in a year, police increase crackdowns
byline: In the wake of online scams doubling in a year with thousands of individuals becoming victims, Sri Lanka Police have increased crackdown on such frauds carried out by both locals and foreigners.

title: ’’A Cloud over the Sun’’
byline: ’’Sooriya Bala Sangramaya’’ (Solar Energy) programme launched around 2016-2017, introducing net-metering and other schemes, boosted by Asian Development Bank funding and leading to rapid capacity increases and milestones in the country.

title: Construction companies seek to bring down 7,500 labour force from foreign countries
byline: Claiming that there is an acute shortage in labour force in the construction industry, Secretary to the Ministry of Housing, Construction and Water Supply Kumudu Lal Bogahawatta said yesterday leading construction companies had sought permission from the Ministry to bring down some 7,500 labour force from foreign countries.

title: ’Miracle baby’ born in a tree above Mozambique floodwaters dies aged 25
byline: She was seen as a ’’miracle baby’’ after being born in a tree which her mother had climbed to escape flooding, but nearly 26 years on Mozambican Rosita Salvador Mabuiango has died after a long illness, her sister told the BBC.

title: Minimum prices of Samba, Keeri Samba paddy increased
byline: In a move aimed at encouraging farmers to cultivate these varieties in upcoming seasons, the Cabinet of Ministers has approved an increase in the minimum purchasing prices for Samba and Keeri Samba paddy.

title: LPL 2026 draft to be held on March 22
byline: The player draft for the sixth edition of the Lanka Premier League (LPL) 2026 will be held on 22 March 2026.

title: Cabinet approves operation of currency exchange counters at BIA arrivals terminal
byline: Currency exchange counters have been established within the customs area of the arrivals terminal at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), Katunayake, to facilitate the foreign exchange requirements of arriving passengers.

title: Doctors launches strike across Eastern Province hospitals
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) today (13) launched a strike across all state hospitals in the Eastern Province, demanding the removal of the Medical Superintendent of the Akkaraipattu Base Hospital.

title: Pelawatte sugar factory sites to be developed as tourist attractions
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved a proposal to develop selected areas of the Pelawatte Sugar Factory, owned by Lanka Sugar (Private) Company Limited, as tourist attraction sites.

title: Cabinet nod to postpone Grade 6 education reforms
byline: The Cabinet has decided to postpone the education reforms for Grade 6 to 2027 as the English language module in question needs to be reviewed, Cabinet Spokesman Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: Motorcyclist arrested for attacking vehicles
byline: A video showing a motorcyclist attacking several moving vehicles using an object along the Kaduwela–Colpetty road was arrested by the Welikada Police.

title: Cabinet approves digital fuel card system for government vehicles
byline: The Cabinet has approved the introduction of a digital card system for fueling vehicles belonging to government institutions, aiming to enhance transparency and efficiency in fuel procurement.

title: Cabinet approves increase of festive advance for government officers to Rs. 15,000
byline: The Cabinet has approved an amendment to the Establishments Code to raise the festive advance provided to government officers from Rs. 10,000 to Rs. 15,000. Circular instructions on the revised provisions will be issued shortly.

title: Trump briefed on military and covert options for Iran, reports
byline: President Donald Trump has been briefed on a wide range of covert and military tools for use in Iran, two Department of Defense officials told the BBC’s US partner, CBS News.

title: China’s school uniform donation brings relief to millions of Sri Lankan families
byline: A large-scale donation of school uniform fabrics by China is set to ease the financial burden on millions of Sri Lankan families as the new school year begins, with more than 4.4 million students expected to benefit from the programme.

title: Former CPC chairman Dhammika Ranatunga to be indicted
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption today informed Colombo Additional Magistrate Nuwan Kaushalya that steps have been taken to file indictments within this week against former Chairman of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation Dhammika Ranatunga, in connection with an ongoing investigation into alleged corruption.

title: New Chief Scout Commissioner of Sri Lanka Scout Association appointed
byline: Attorney-at-Law Manoj Nanayakkara has been appointed as the new Chief Scout Commissioner of the Sri Lanka Scout Association.

title: Complaint lodged against Lal Kantha’s statement targeting Mihintale chief incumbent
byline: A complaint has been lodged against Agriculture, Livestock, Lands and Irrigation Minister K. D. Lal Kantha over statements allegedly targeting the chief incumbent of Mihintale Rajamaha Viharaya, Walawahangunawewe Dhammarathana Thera.

title: Teachers, President and PM agree to collaborate on education reforms
byline: A meeting between President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, and representatives of teachers’ trade unions was held this afternoon (13) at the Presidential Secretariat to discuss the Government’s new education reform initiatives.

title: Wimal has to continue his Satyagraha: Nalinda
byline: Former MP Wimal Weerawansa has to continue his ’Satyagraha’ as the government will not remove Harini Amarasuriya as the Prime Minister or the Minister of Education, Cabinet Spokesman Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: Trump says nations doing business with Iran face 25% tariff on US trade
byline: President Donald Trump said on Monday any country that does business with Iran will face a tariff rate of 25% on any trade with the U.S., as Washington weighs a response to the situation in Iran which is seeing its biggest anti-government protests in years.

title: SLBFE provides over Rs. 1 billion in welfare benefits to migrant worker families in 2025
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) has provided welfare benefits exceeding Rs. 1 billion in 2025 to overseas Sri Lankan workers and their families, strengthening social protection measures for migrant workers.

title: Wimal Weerawansa calls off ’satyagraha’
byline: Former MP and National Freedom Front (NFF) leader Wimal Weerawansa has decided to call off his continuous ’satyagraha’ campaign held in front of the Ministry of Education.

title: Mihintale Thera says he is to meet Donald Trump
byline: The Chief Incumbent of the Mihintale Rajamaha Viharaya, Walawahangunawewe Dhammarathana Thera, has criticised the government’s proposed education reforms, claiming they would cause harm to the country.

title: Bangladesh won’t play T20 World Cup matches in India, BCB reaffirms
byline: “The BCB reaffirmed its position regarding the decision not to travel to India, citing security concerns,” the BCB said in a media release on Tuesday.
